item.title: Hacker News Top Stories: Sunday, November 10, 2024 at 1:15 AM UTC
item.description:
1. OpenCoder: Open Cookbook for Top-Tier Code Large Language Models (262 points | 36 comments)
2. Show HN: Visprex – Open-source, in-browser data visualisation tool for CSV files (61 points | 8 comments)
3. IronCalc – Open-Source Spreadsheet Engine (205 points | 72 comments)
4. Show HN: Jaws – a JavaScript to WASM ahead-of-time compiler (138 points | 55 comments)
5. Zig's (.{}){} Syntax (105 points | 49 comments)
6. NYC Subway Station Layouts (94 points | 40 comments)
7. Early Cascade Injection: From Windows process creation to stealthy injection (82 points | 8 comments)
8. Mergiraf: a syntax-aware merge driver for Git (315 points | 69 comments)
9. Grim Fandango (88 points | 30 comments)
10. FrontierMath: A benchmark for evaluating advanced mathematical reasoning in AI (62 points | 23 comments)
11. LLMs have reached a point of diminishing returns (60 points | 33 comments)
12. Show HN: HTML-to-Markdown – convert entire websites to Markdown with Golang/CLI (241 points | 43 comments)
13. When machine learning tells the wrong story (59 points | 1 comment)
14. Scientist treated her own cancer with viruses she grew in the lab (396 points | 158 comments)
15. You too can write a book (51 points | 11 comments)
16. Texture-Less Text Rendering (175 points | 46 comments)
17. With AI, the future of augmented reality is in your ears (23 points | 18 comments)
18. HPV vaccination: How the world can eliminate cervical cancer (296 points | 126 comments)
19. Trellis (YC W24) is hiring eng to turn documents into database ( | hide)
20. Obtainium: Get Android App Updates Directly from the Source (157 points | 70 comments)
21. SVDQuant: 4-Bit Quantization Powers 12B Flux on a 16GB 4090 GPU with 3x Speedup (150 points | 49 comments)
22. Ticketmaster’s attempt to game arbitration services fails (235 points | 90 comments)
23. HashML-DSA Considered Harmful (6 points | discuss)
24. Somebody moved UK's oldest satellite (81 points | 41 comments)
25. Since the '60s, Ford has stored cars underground in a Kansas City cave (133 points | 45 comments)
26. Notes on Guyana (107 points | 99 comments)
27. Can humans say the largest prime number before we find the next one? (279 points | 127 comments)
28. A Brief History of Cyrix (63 points | 11 comments)
29. The Saturn V FUELDRAULIC Gimbal System (1963) (39 points | 13 comments)
30. Memories are not only in the brain, human cell study finds (199 points | 94 comments)
item.guid: Hacker News Top Stories: Sunday, November 10, 2024 at 1:15 AM UTC
